New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers set a new record with 10-0 start to the season
Key Match Events: Cleveland detonated a 19-2 run in the first five minutes
Ty Jerome led Cleveland's onslaught with 13 second-quarter points
Darius Garland's eight-point run by himself with four minutes remaining took the fight out of the Bay Area team
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr did not insert Curry in the fourth quarter
The Warriors couldnâ€™t put together a desperate rally as the Cavaliers had an answer to everything the Dubs threw at them
Cleveland won 136-117 to improve its NBA-best record to 10-0
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dubs, which had the most efficient defense entering the matchup, couldn't slow down the Cavaliers
The disparity in 3-point shooting allowed the Cavaliers to grab a stranglehold on the game
Donovan Mitchell and Co. improved their record to 10-0 while Steph Curry's Warriors dropped to 7-2
Others: The game was played on Nov. 8, 2024, and the box score is for the 2024-25 NBA season
